<!-- Generated by Harlequin Webmaker 2.1.3; Transducer 1.0.2 --> <HTML> <HEAD> <TITLE> The ACES Project</TITLE> </HEAD> <BODY> <H1> The ACES Project</H1> Principal Investigators: <A HREF="../faculty/rego.html">Vernon J. Rego</A>, Vaidy Sunderam<P> Research Assistants: B. Dimitrov, J.-C. Gomez, F. Knop, E. Mascarenhas, R. Pasquini<P> Sponsor: ONR, ARO, DoE, NSF, PRF<P> <IMG SRC="goldRule.gif" width =100%> <P> The ACES system is a layered software architecture for high-performance distributed computation and simulation, including the Ariadne/Arachne threads systems, the Conch/Clam communications environments and a multithreaded CMPI subsystem, the EcliPSe replicated simulation system and the (para)Sol process-oriented simulation environment. The system is process- and object-oriented, supporting applications on heterogeneous network environments made up of machines ranging from desktop workstations to massively parallel hardware multiprocessors. <P> <IMG SRC="goldRule.gif" width =100%> </BODY> </HTML> </HTML>
</DOC>
